title: Synthetic Recap
body:
DALLAS – In a performance that defied the very geometry of the sport, Steve Smith of the Atlanta Hawks authored a masterpiece for the ages, single-handedly dismantling the Dallas Mavericks in a 112-79 road rout. The final score was a mere formality; the true story was etched line by line in Smith’s historic, and staggering, 44-point tally.

From the opening tip, Smith was an unstoppable force, a symphony of offensive precision played against a helpless Dallas defense. He didn't just score; he dominated every facet of the offensive end, finishing with a stat line that seemed plucked from a video game: 44 points, 7 rebounds, and 5 assists. Each possession was a clinic, as Smith carved up the Mavericks with a blend of silky jumpers and relentless drives to the basket.

While the Hawks' supporting cast, led by Christian Laettner's quiet 14 points, provided a steady foundation, the night belonged unequivocally to Smith. His scoring outburst was so profound it rendered the Mavericks' efforts moot. The Dallas offense, paced by A.C. Green's 15 points, simply had no answer and could not muster the firepower to keep pace with the one-man hurricane in a Hawks uniform.

The game was less a contest and more a coronation of an individual's brilliance. As the final seconds ticked away on the 1998 season, the narrative was crystal clear. This was not merely an Atlanta Hawks victory; it was the Steve Smith Game, a legendary 44-point explosion that will forever be remembered as one of the most dominant individual performances ever witnessed on the hardwood.
